newsitem.title: USA: Venezuela telephone files to offer $100 mln shares.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela telephone files to offer $100 mln shares.

text.p: National Telephone Company of Venezuela said Wednesday it filed a registration with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $100 million in Class D shares in its initial public offering.
The company has been approved for listing on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "VNT", the filing said.
The joint global coordinators are Lehman Brothers and SBC Warburg, a division of Swiss Bank Corp, the filing said.

The company and selling stockholders will offer both American Depositary Shares and Class D shares. However, there has not been a set amount established for the offering nor an estimated price per share, the filing said.

Prior to the global offering, the government, through the Venezuelan Investment Fund, the Industrial Bank of Venezuela and the Ministry of Transportation and Communications, owned 49 percent and VenWorld owned 40 percent.
Employees and retirees of the company owned about 10 percent. The remaining one percent was not explained in the filing.
The company will not receive any proceeds from the offering, the filing said.

The company, headquartered in Caracas, is a full service telecommunications provider offering switched, fixed local and domestic and international long distance telephone service throughout Venezuela on an exclusive basis under October 2000.
